Method Detail

getConnection

static java.lang.Object getConnection(java.net.InetAddress ip)
                               throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                                      java.lang.InstantiationException,
                                      java.awt.HeadlessException,
                                      java.sql.SQLException
Attempts to store a database connection into an object. Will throw exceptions if connection fails or will return null. May return an object that is already initialized if it was done so previously.

Returns:
Connection a connection that can be manipulated. The connection should exist purely for holding the connection until the database needs to be disconnected (a very unlikely scenario in the real-world use) and then it should be able to be assigned to a null value after db is closed.
Object is essentially an anchor for holding a connection as long as needed
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - - This exception is thrown if the mysql jdbc library is not found.
java.lang.IllegalAccessException
java.lang.InstantiationException
java.sql.SQLException
java.awt.HeadlessException
